channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Man Drives Car Into Crowd Outside Primary School in China
item.description: The incident followed an attack by a driver last week that left 35 people dead, and a mass stabbing several days later.

item.title: What does Spirit Airlines’ bankruptcy filing mean for travelers?
item.description: The airline has lost more than $2.5 billion since the beginning of 2020 while also racking up mounting debt.

item.title: Ken Martin, a Minnesotan With Deep Democratic Ties, Joins the D.N.C. Race

item.title: Don’t Blame Polling for Our Infuriating Politics
item.description: Why it can’t fix our messy politics.

item.title: Dozens of Hong Kong Pro-Democracy Leaders Sentenced in Mass Trial
item.description: The 45 defendants, including Joshua Wong, were at the forefront of the opposition movement crushed by Beijing. Many had already been in jail for years...

item.title: Undersea cables between Germany and Finland severed—sparking suspicion of sabotage
item.description: "We must protect ourselves better and be able to react quickly, competently and appropriately to such attacks."

item.title: The SEC’s Gary Gensler must refrain from doing more harm to crypto on his way out the door
item.description: Gensler’s a goner. His campaign of of crypto antagonism must stop right now.

item.title: Explosive Claims About Gaetz, and Dozens Jailed in Hong Kong Mass Trial
item.description: Plus, the man who opened travel to the masses.

item.title: Swiss watch exports fall again amid plummeting demand in China
item.description: Swiss watch exports are on track to post an overall decline in 2024 for the first time since the pandemic disrupted yearly sales in 2020.
